Key Match Events: Benin Republic came from behind to defeat Libya 2-1 in the second match of Group Dâ€™s MatchDay 2 contest in Abidjan on Tuesday night.

Faisal Saleh converted a 9th minute penalty kick for Libya, but Benin Republic restored parity from a rifling shot by Steve Mounie five minutes into the second half, and then seized the momentum and got a penalty kick which Junior Olaitan converted.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cheetahs of Benin however have a two goal deficit in goal difference.
The Nigerians on four points and not conceding any goal yet remain atop of the group while Benin Republic with three points rank next.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match day 3 will hold next month as Nigeria hosts Libya while Benin, playing back-to-back at home will host Rwanda.
The Super Eagles of Nigeria to inhumane treatment at the Al Abaq Airport by Libyan authorities.
Others: The article discusses the ongoing AFCON 2025 qualifiers and the match between Benin Republic and Libya, as well as the treatment of the Super Eagles by Libyan authorities.
